intro: Dehaasia brachybotrys, commonly known as the short-stalked bract plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features opposite leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and can range in color from white to pink, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
